chunk_text:
CONSTRUCTION GUARANTEE/WARRANTY 
Notwithstanding any  certificate which may have been given by the Owner or the 
Engineer, if any equipment, materials, or workmanship which does not comply with 
the requirements of this Contract shall be discovered within one (1) year after

materials or remedy any such defective workmanship within thirty (30) days after 
Owner provides written notice of the existence thereof

summary.summary: A contractor or owner may receive an equitable adjustment to the contract price when contract performance is impacted by events beyond the contractor's control, such as force majeure or owner-initiated changes after contract execution. The contractor must provide evidence of each event, and the owner's project manager will issue a certificate confirming the event and its date if satisfied with the evidence.

chunk_text:
EQUITABLE ADJUSTMENTS 
Contractor or Owner may be entitled to an equitable adjustment in the contract 
price if perfo rmance of the Contract is affected by events outside the reasonable 
control of the Contractor, including events provided for under the force majeure 
clause or those necessitated by Owner requests made after the Contract is executed, 
If such an event occurs , the Contractor shall provide evidence that each such event 
has taken place and the Owner’s Project Manager shall, if satisfied with such 
evidence, thereupon issue a suitable certificate for each event stating the date on 
which it occurred

RECORDS 
Contractor will maintain records, in accordance with U.S. Generally  Accepted 
Accounting Principles, suitably detailed to substantiate Contractor’s work and 
charges under this Contract.  Contractor shall maintain such records for three (3) 
years from the end of the contract year in which such charges were incurred, at 
which time Contractor shall return such records to Owner’s corporate office.  
Contractor is urged to retain records in electronic form where practicable
